articles.title: HP To Acquire Parts of Humane, Shut Down the AI Pin
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: HP will buy the majority of the assets of Humane, maker of a wearable AI pin, for $116 million. There will be a time and place for pure AI devices, anonymous reader quotes a report from Bloomberg as saying that it will be introduced in late 2023.

articles.author: Lance Ulanoff
articles.summary: HP bought the AI-powered pin from Humane for $116 million. The pin was a wearable AI computing device that arrived in November 2023. Futurism warns that rushing into this could lead to serious issues.

articles.title: AI hallucinations could get lawyers fired, law firm says
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Morgan & Morgan sent an urgent email to its more than 1,000 lawyers about the dangers of using artificial intelligence in court filings. A federal judge in Wyoming threatened to sanction two lawyers at the firm for using fictitious case citations in a lawsuit against Walmart. One of the lawyers admitted in court that he used an AI program that 'hallucinated' the cases.

articles.summary: Humane, an AI hardware startup, is closing down and selling its assets to HP Inc. for $116 million. articles.title: HP is buying Humane and shutting down the AI Pin
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Humane is selling AI Pins to HP for $116 million. Pins that have already been purchased will continue to function normally until 3 PM ET on February 28th. After that date, Pins will no longer connect to Humane's servers and features will be permanently deleted. Refunds must be submitted by February 27th, 2025.

articles.title: Humane is shutting down the AI Pin and selling its remnants to HP
articles.author: Jay Peters
articles.summary: Humane is selling most of its company to HP for $116 million and will stop selling AI Pins. Pins that have already been purchased will continue to function normally until 3 PM ET on February 28th. After that date, Pins will no longer connect to Humane's servers and features like calling, messaging, AI queries and cloud access will be permanently deleted. Refunds must be submitted by February 27th 2025.

articles.title: India seeks AI breakthrough - but is it falling behind?
articles.author: Nikhil Inamdar
articles.summary: Two years after ChatGPT took the world by storm, China's DeepSeek has sent ripples through the tech industry by collapsing the cost for developing generative artificial intelligence applications. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman this month said India should be playing a leading role in the AI revolution. India has 200 startups working on generative AI. It's in the top five on Stanford's AI Vibrancy Index, but it's far behind China and the US in terms of funding, research, policy and talent.

articles.title: Generative AI in journalism, and what people think about its impact
articles.author: T.J. Thomson
articles.summary: Generative artificial intelligence (AI) has taken off at lightning speed in the past couple of years. Newsrooms are no exception. Only 25% of news audience participants were confident they had encountered generative AI in journalism. About 50% were unsure or suspected they had. This suggests a potential lack of transparency from news organizations and a lack of trust between news outlets and audiences.

It is designed to auto-generate police reports using only an officer's body cam audio records.

The company has a revenue target of $40 billion for fiscal 2026, which is above Wall Street's expectations. The delay in filing key financial reports previously sent shares plunging more than 80% from their peak. Management has committed to filing by February 25 to avoid a potential Nasdaq delisting.
